Key Match Events: Cincinnati cruised to an easy 8-4 win over the Twins in the most recent game of this series.
The Reds had a huge 7th inning, scoring six of their eight runs.
Julian Aguiar pitched well for the Reds, going 6 1/3 innings and giving up just three hits and three earned runs.
TJ Friedl and Elly De La Cruz each homered for the Reds.
Spencer Steer scored twice and drove in two runs while going 2/4.
Jonathan India also had a two-hit game and scored a run.
Pre-Game Insights: There is a chance for rain in Minneapolis on Saturday, where the forecasted temperature is 65 degrees.
The Reds and Twins are facing off in an interleague matchup at 7:10 PM ET.
The Twins are favored on the money line (-153).
Nick Martinez will go for the Reds, while the Twins are sending Simeon Woods Richardson to the mound.
The over/under line is currently 8.5 runs, and the under is favored at -119.
We have the Twins winning by a score of 5 to 4.
If you're looking for a run line pick, we like the Reds to cover.
As for an over/under pick, we have this game finishing with 9 runs and like the over.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game will be played at Target Field at 7:10 ET on Saturday, September 14th.
MLBN will be televising Saturday's Reds vs. Twins matchup.
